schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

schema.name: QueueManager
schema.summary: An IBM MQ Queue Manager name
schema.label: Queue manager
schema.hoverhelp: Specify the queue manager that manages the distributed send and receive queues of IBM MQ. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower Gateway corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.
schema.description: Select a Queue Manager from the list of available Queue Managers. The queue manager provides messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring or polling queues, and by ensuring that messages are directed to the correct receive queue or routed to another queue manager. The queue manager on the DataPower Gateway corresponds to a queue manager running on another host on the network.

schema.name: GetQueue
schema.summary: The GET queue associated with the queue manager
schema.label: GET queue
schema.hoverhelp: Specify the GET queue associated with the queue manager. The handler will get messages from this queue.
schema.description: Enter the name of the GET queue associated with the identified Queue Manager. The handler will get messages from this queue.

schema.name: GetMessageOptions
schema.summary: Options flags for the MQGMO structure
schema.description: Specifies the cumulative value of the MQGET options that are applicable to an IBM MQ message in decimal or hex format. The value is passed directly to the IBM MQ API. The default value is 32769, which is the decimal value for the MQGMO_WAIT and MQGMO_LOGICAL_ORDER options.

schema.name: ConcurrentConnections
schema.summary: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this source protocol handler
schema.display: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations
schema.description: The number of concurrent IBM MQ conversations allocated for this handler. The default value is 1, but it can be increased to improve performance.

schema.name: PollingInterval
schema.summary: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available
schema.label: Polling interval
schema.hoverhelp: Enter the time, in seconds, before the MQGET operation returns if no message is available. The next attempt is performed immediately. Setting a low value helps to detect network connectivity issues and queue manager power shutdown but increases network traffic. The minimum value is 1. The default value is 30.
schema.description: The number of seconds before MQGET operation returns if no messages are available, the next attempt will be performed immediately. Setting this value to minimum will help to detect quickly network connectivity issues and queue manager power shutdown but at the same time will increase network traffic.

schema.name: RetrieveBackoutSettings
schema.summary: Controls retrieval of backout settings from the IBM MQ server
schema.description: <p>Controls whether to retrieve backout setting from the IBM MQ server.</p><p>When enabled, retrieves the <b>Backout Threshold</b> and <b>Backout Requeue Queue Name</b> settings from the IBM MQ server and checks these values. On a reattempt, the IBM MQ handler uses the higher priority backout settings from the server. If the server does not contain backout settings, The handler uses any existing backout values, either empty or populated, from the local IBM MQ queue manager. If there are no backout settings, the backout function is disabled.</p><p>When an alias queue is used, its attributes are retrieved, not those of the base queue.</p>

schema.name: IgnoreBackoutErrors
schema.summary: Controls whether to ignore backout errors
schema.description: <p>Controls whether to ignore backout errors</p><p>When disabled, the default, roll back and retry the transfer.</p><p>When enabled, ignore the error in sending the transfer to the backout queue and commit the transfer from the get queue.</p>

schema.name: UseQMNameInURL
schema.summary: Whether to use the queue manager or the queue manager group in the front side URL
schema.description: <p>Indicates whether the var://service/URL-in variable returns the name of IBM MQ Queue Manager or the name of the IBM MQ Queue Manager Group when this configuration defines a queue manager group as the queue manager.</p><ul><li>When <b>on</b>, the variable returns the name of the queue manager.</li><li>When <b>off</b>, the default, the variable returns the name of the queue manager group.</li></ul>
